steps.title: Notice if your baby is crying.
steps.content: Notice if your baby is crying. Sometimes it may be time to change their diaper, once they begin crying. You may know that you have to change a nappy, if the baby cries. [1] X Research source Maybe if you're babysitting or something like that, the baby will burst into tears. Remember to focus on other reasons before ripping the nappy open.

steps.title: Smell the baby's bottom.
steps.content: Smell the baby's bottom. Turn the baby around and take a good whiff, if you are brave enough! Just hold up the baby, smell and let your senses do the rest. If you are close to passing out then yeah, the baby needs changing.

steps.title: Try feeling it with two fingers just a little farther down than the top tagline of the diaper in the front of the baby.
steps.content: Try feeling it with two fingers just a little farther down than the top tagline of the diaper in the front of the baby. REMEMBER, this is only for the brave hearted, or if you feel comfortable enough doing this. However, the nappy is soft and plump so this step might not get you far. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Hold your hand over the front section of your baby's diaper and slightly jiggle the diaper to see if it moves.
steps.content: Hold your hand over the front section of your baby's diaper and slightly jiggle the diaper to see if it moves. A diaper that moves like jelly is mostly wet and will need to be changed soon (or immediately).

steps.title: Open it up with the diaper tapes and take a quick peek.
steps.content: Open it up with the diaper tapes and take a quick peek. and take a look for yourself. But do this in hygienic places. Not in the middle of the street. [3] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source
